meanings.def: used to say that somebody will/will not get a particular job or position because they have/do not have the appearance, personality, etc. that the employer wants, even when this should not be important
examples: If your face fits, you'll get the job.

examples: She was at an early age brought face to face with the horrors of war.

meanings.def: with your face and stomach facing upwards/downwards
examples: She lay face down on the bed.

meanings.def: with the front part or surface facing upwards/downwards
examples: Place the card face up on the pile.

meanings.def: to fall so that you are lying on your front
to fail completely, usually in an embarrassing way

meanings.def: to eat a lot of food or too much food

examples: They were left with egg on their faces when only ten people showed up.

meanings.def: despite problems, difficulties, etc.

meanings.def: to be less respected or look stupid because of something you have done

meanings.def: used to say that something seems to be good, true, etc. but that this opinion may need to be changed when you know more about it
